Greg_Bates:
{{Short description|American country music singer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Greg Bates | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|09|25}}[http://www.countryhamfest.com/apps/GregBatesBio.pdf Greg Bates Biography from Hamfest] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061111074120/http://countryhamfest.com/apps/GregBatesBio.pdf |date=November 11, 2006 }} Country Hamfest. Retrieved on May 1, 2012. | birth_place = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | origin = [[Brentwood, Tennessee]], U.S. | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2011–present | label = [[Republic Nashville]] | associated_acts = }} '''Greg Bates''' (born September 25, 1987) is an American [[country music]] singer formerly signed to [[Republic Nashville]]. Bates also is a songwriter, producer, singer, and guitarist.{{Cite web |title=Greg Bates |url=https://www.songfinch.com/artists/82855 |access-date=2023-05-10 |website=Songfinch |language=en}}{{Cite web |date=2022-06-12 |title=Ten Years After "Did It for the Girl," Greg Bates is Right Where He Wants to Be |url=https://procountrymusic.com/2022/06/11/ten-years-after-did-it-for-the-girl-greg-bates-is-right-where-he-wants-to-be/ |access-date=2023-05-10 |website=Pro Country |language=en}} ==Early life== In 2006, Bates graduated from [[Ravenwood High School]]. Bates then graduated in 2010 with a degree in Music Business from [[Belmont University]]. He signed a recording contract in the fall of 2011.[https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2012/11/18/did-it-for-the-girl-greg-bates-on-the-verge/1710439/ On the Verge: Country singer Greg Bates] USA Today. Retrieved on November 3, 2012. Bates quietly parted ways with Republic Nashville towards the end of 2013. ==Personal life== He proposed to girlfriend Shelley Skidmore on Valentine's Day 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/zFwndxhWjr/ |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/instagram/gregbatesofficial/920355517128599787 |archive-date=December 25, 2021 |url-access=registration|title=Greg Bates on Instagram: "One year ago today I was a nervous wreck driving 4 hours to propose to @shelleyskidmore. Thanks for saying yes baby #ValentinesDay" |website=Instagram.com |date= |accessdate=March 21, 2020}}{{cbignore}} The couple was married on May 2, 2015 in Stanton, Kentucky. Stanton is Shelley's hometown. The two posted up wedding pictures on Instagram.{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/greg-bates-married/ |title=Greg Bates Gets Married |website=Theboot.com |date= May 7, 2015|accessdate=March 21, 2020}} ==Musical career== In April 2012, Bates released his debut single "Did It for the Girl", which debuted at Number 57 on the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart dated for April 28, 2012.[https://web.archive.org/web/20120423033736/http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1683569/lionel-richies-tuskegee-recaptures-no-1.jhtml News : Lionel Richie's Tuskegee Recaptures No. 1]. CMT (April 21, 2012). Retrieved on November 13, 2012. Billy Dukes gave the song four stars out of five, saying that it is "instantly memorable — if only for its clean simplicity."[http://tasteofcountry.com/greg-bates-did-it-for-the-girl/ Greg Bates, ‘Did It for the Girl’ – Song Review]. Tasteofcountry.com (April 20, 2012). Retrieved on November 13, 2012. Bates made his [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut in April 2012.[http://tasteofcountry.com/greg-bates-grand-ole-opry/ Greg Bates Makes His Debut at the Grand Ole Opry]. Tasteofcountry.com (May 3, 2012). Retrieved on November 13, 2012.[http://www.musicrow.com/2012/05/greg-bates-makes-opry-debut/ Greg Bates Makes Opry Debut : MusicRow – Nashville's Music Industry Publication – News, Songs From Music City]. Musicrow.com (May 7, 2012). Retrieved on November 13, 2012. The album's second single, "Fill in the Blank," was released to country radio on February 11, 2013. Bates has received air play as a "Highway Find" on satellite radio channel [[The Highway (Sirius XM)]]. ==Discography== ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
